intro: Malcolmia karelinii, commonly known as the Kashmir sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Malcolmia karelinii is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
